image_processing_functions.name: show_image
image_processing_functions.explanation: This function can export an individual image in the Output Image tab in the image panel. All the image exported using this function will go into the same tab called Texture. You can download each by clicking the button on the image.

image_processing_functions.name: blank_image
parameters: <n1>: R channel value of the background color
<n2>: G channel value of the background color
<n3>: B channel value of the background color
<n4>: Alpha channel value of the background color
image_processing_functions.explanation: Generate a black empty image. First four arguments (<number(u8)>) are RGBA values, the last two are width and height. Below is an example to generate a solid black image of size 50 250.

image_processing_functions.name: darken
image_processing_functions.explanation: darken a target image with given a given value by reducing red, green and blue channel all by the given value. The given value should be within 0-255, a channel whose value surpasses the limit will be adjusted to boudary 0 or 255 accordingly

image_processing_functions.name: grayscale
image_processing_functions.explanation: Convert an image into a grayscale image. The new pixel value becomes the average of the original RGB value each multiplied with a coefficient.

image_processing_functions.name: invert_color
image_processing_functions.explanation: Invert the color an image. Value in each RGB channel will be 255 - current value.

image_processing_functions.name: mask_channel_r
image_processing_functions.explanation: Mask the red channel to show only blue and green channel.

image_processing_functions.name: mask_channel_g
image_processing_functions.explanation: Mask the green channel to show only blue and red channel.

image_processing_functions.name: mask_channel_b
image_processing_functions.explanation: Mask the blue channel to show only red and green channel.

image_processing_functions.name: blur
image_processing_functions.explanation: Blur an image with gaussian blur.

new_material.name: new_material
new_material.explanation: New materials can be generated from new_material functions. Remove the space between words and add double quotes before and after to make it a string. Any images or textures assigned to its maps will implicitly resize to the size of this material.

maps.name: Metalness
maps.description: Black and white image that serves as a mask to describe if an area behaves like metal. For masks, white indicates true and black indicates false.

maps.name: Roughness
maps.description: Describe how rough the surface is. Black for smooth surface and white for completely rough surface. A smoother surface has a more intense and bright highlight, while rougher surface has larger dimmer highlight.

maps.name: Diffuse
maps.description: Base color input, also the color of reflective metal. As it’s name infer, it’s a reflection of light in many directions.

maps.name: Normal
maps.description: Describes the bumps and dents of a surface without deforming a geometry. RGB value corresponds to XYZ axis that an area deforms.

maps.name: Transparency
maps.description: Describes whether an area should be transparent, opaque or in between. Same as for the mask, white means the area is opaque and black for not being visible.

maps.name: Ambient Occlusion (AO)
maps.description: A grayscale map used to create soft shadows. White means full indirect lighting is received and black for no indirect lighting received.

maps.name: Displacement
maps.description: Describes the displacement of an area from the original surface. The difference between normal map and displacement map is that displacement map alters the geometry.

maps.name: Emissive
maps.description: Also called an incandescence map. Used if the objects illuminates itself with a light color. Black means no light emitted.

maps.name: Cavity
maps.description: Also called crevice map that represents that dark shading of a crevice, which is similar to the blue channel for Z axis in normal map.

maps.name: Subsurface Scattering
maps.description: Subsurface scattering in short describes a light that penetrates a translucent surface and reflected many times at random angle before exiting the surface. Usually used for materials such as skin, milk and marble.

maps.name: Specular
maps.description: Color of specular reflection. If used for a metal, this will be the color the metal appears to be. Generally white for non metals.

maps.name: Glossiness
maps.description: Amount of highlight a material has. Black results in the material appears to be matte, and white for a very glossy/shiny one.

maps.name: Albedo
maps.description: Similar to a diffuse map that shows the base color of a material.
